author: Michael Stone
title: GOP Senator Claims EPA Is ‘Brainwashing Our Kids’
text:
Christian conservative and Oklahoma Senator James Inhofe accuses the EPA of creating “propaganda” and “brainwashing” American children. 
Appearing on CNN earlier today Inhofe defended budget cuts for the the Environmental Protection Agency by claiming the agency is creating “propaganda” and “brainwashing” American children. 
About pending budget cuts to the EPA, the GOP senator and conservative Christian told CNN’s Poppy Harlow: 
We are going to take all this stuff that comes out of the EPA that is brainwashing our kids, that is propaganda, things that aren’t true, allegations. 
CNN reports Inhofe did not have any specific examples to back up his claim. 
Inhofe is no stranger to making ridiculous claims. The man is an idiot, and believes that human influenced climate change is impossible because “God’s still up there.” 
Appearing on the Voice of Christian Youth America’s radio program Inhofe defended his climate change denial by referring to arguments he made in his book: The Greatest Hoax: How the Global Warming Conspiracy Threatens Your Future 
Inhofe said : 
Well actually the Genesis 8:22 that I use in there is that ‘as long as the earth remains there will be seed time and harvest, cold and heat, winter and summer, day and night,’ my point is, God’s still up there. The arrogance of people to think that we, human beings, would be able to change what He is doing in the climate is to me outrageous. 
New Republic reports Inhofe made similar claims in a 2015 address to the U.S. Senate. At the time Inhofe declared: 
Climate is changing and climate has always changed and always will. The hoax is that there are some people who are so arrogant to think they are so powerful they can change climate. Man can’t change climate. 
The Hill reports that under President Trump’s proposed federal budget the EPA is facing a budget cut of 31 percent. The budget only provides $5.7 billion for the EPA, down from $8.3 billion. 
Bottom line: A climate change denying Christian extremist like Senator Inhofe has no business speaking about “propaganda,”“brainwashing,” or much of anything else. In fact, the man is clearly confused, and is himself a victim of brainwashing and propaganda.
